answers.answer: Hi, the symptoms described by you could be due to neuropathy. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. You may need to consult your primary care physician to detect the cause. Regards.

question: For about two months the right half of my body, head to tow, especially legs and feet, have tingling and numbness.  At first I noticed it during a hard cough.  Now it seems almost continuous.  It is mild yet disconcerting.  I am a 60 year old man in fairly good shape with regular exercise.  6'2", 210 pounds.
title: tingling numbness
